name: hm
tagline: Archaeological sequence diagrams and chronological models
body:
# hm ============= Write Graphviz `dot` files for archaeological sequence diagrams and chronological models. Convert a sequence diagram to a chronological model. ## Requirements The `hm` package is Common Lisp software that runs on [SBCL](http://www.sbcl.org/) or [Clozure CL](http://ccl.clozure.com/). It is convenient to install the software with [the `git` distributed version control system](http://git-scm.com/). The output file produced by the `hm` package is source code for [Graphviz `dot`](http://www.graphviz.org/). ## Install Installation with [Quicklisp](http://www.quicklisp.org) is recommended. It automatically installs [dependencies](http://eschulte.github.io/graph/). `cd ~/quicklisp/local-projects/` `git clone https://github.com/tsdye/harris-matrix.git` ## Load `(ql:quickload "hm")` ## Draw `(in-package hm)` `(hm-draw "path/to/configuration/file")` ## Overview The `hm` package produces Graphviz `dot` source code for archaeological sequence diagrams from tables of stratigraphic observations, inferences, and interpretations. With the addition of a table of radiocarbon dates, the `hm` package will produce a Bayesian chronological model. The `hm` package provides a single function, `hm-draw`, which expects a valid path to a configuration file as its sole argument. The configuration file specifies paths to one or more data files and sets values for several dozen Graphviz `dot` variables. The configuration information and the data are held in comma separated value files. Together, the configuration and data files can hold a complete description of site stratigraphy and its interpretation. ## Example Output The stratigraphic section shown in Figure 12 of Edward Harris' book, _Principles of Archaeological Stratigraphy_. Note that the symbol for a deposit is a box and for an interface a trapezium. In this example, the nodes are colored according to the directed graph concept of _level_. ![fig-12-harris-levels-tred.svg](http://harris-matrix.tsdye.com/img/fig-12-harris-levels-tred.svg) Another view of the stratigraphic section shown in Figure 12 of Edward Harris' book, _Principles of Archaeological Stratigraphy_. In this example, layer interfaces are recognized and the nodes are colored to reflect the relationship of Context 4 to other contexts in a Bayesian chronological model. ![fig-12-distance-from-4-layer-interfaces-set24-tred.svg](http://harris-matrix.tsdye.com/img/fig-12-distance-from-4-layer-interfaces-set24-tred.svg) ## Data Tables There are seven data tables used as input to `hm`. Examples of each are provided in the `hm` git repository. ### Units of Stratification This table describes the contexts identified by the archaeologist. - **label:** context identifier (primary key) - **unit-type:** interface or deposit - **position:** surface/basal/other - **period:** period identifier (foreign key) - **phase:** phase identifier (foreign key) - **url:** node link (svg output only) ### Observed Stratigraphic Relations This table includes observations of stratigraphic superposition. Its first two columns refer to values from the `label` column of the contexts table. - **younger:** stratigraphically superior context label (foreign key) - **older:** stratigraphically inferior context label (foreign key) - **url:** arc link (svg output only) ### Inferred Parity Relations This table contains inferences of parity between pairs of discontiguous contexts. - **first:** context label (foreign key) - **second:** context label (foreign key) ### Periods This table describes periods, which are groups of interfacial contexts believed to have been in use at the same time. - **id:** a unique integer to identify the period (primary key) - **label:** name of the period used in the legend - **color:** zero-based integer scale for a [Brewer color](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/colors.html#brewer) - **description:** optional field not used by `hm` ### Phases This table describes phases, which are groups of depositional contexts believed to have been deposited pene-contemporaneously, typically because they share diagnostic artifactual content. - **id:** a unique integer to identify the phase (primary key) - **label:** name of the phase used in the legend - **color:** zero-based integer scale for a [Brewer color](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/colors.html#brewer) - **description:** optional field not used by `hm` ### Dates This table associates radiocarbon dates with events and contexts. - **theta:** unique label (primary key) - **context:** context identifier (foreign key) - **lab:** dating laboratory identifier ### Date Order This optional table contains information on the temporal order of dated events from the same context. - **older:** theta label of older date (foreign key) - **younger:** theta label of younger date (foreign key) ## Configuration File The following table describes the variables that can be set in a configuration file.
Variable Description
\*out-file\* Output file path for the sequence diagram dot file
\*chronology-out-file\* Output file path for the chronology diagram dot file
\*context-table-name\* Input file path for the context table
\*observation-table-name\* Input file path for the observation table
\*inference-table-name\* Optional input file path for the inference table
\*period-table-name\* Optional input file path for the period table
\*phase-table-name\* Optional input file path for the phase table
\*radiocarbon-table-name\* Optional input file path for the radiocarbon table
\*date-order-table-name\* Optional input file path for the date order table
\*context-table-header\* Switch for a header line in the context table; \`t' for header, \`nil' for no header
\*observation-table-header\* Switch for a header line in the observation table; \`t' for header, \`nil' for no header
\*inference-table-header\* Switch for a header line in the inference table; \`t' for header, \`nil' for no header
\*period-table-header\* Switch for a header line in the period table; \`t' for header, \`nil' for no header
\*phase-table-header\* Switch for a header line in the phase table; \`t' for header, \`nil' for no header
\*radiocarbon-table-header\* Switch for a header line in the radiocarbon table; \`t' for header, \`nil' for no header
\*date-order-table-header\* Switch for a header line in the date order table; \`t' for header, \`nil' for no header
\*symbolize-unit-type\* \`t' to distinguish interfaces and deposits, \`nil' otherwise
\*create-chronology-graph\* Switch for a chronology graph; \`t'
\*node-fill-by\* \`nil' for no fill, \`levels', \`reachable', \`periods', \`phases'
\*label-break\* Switch from dark to light label color
\*color-scheme\* [Brewer color scheme](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/colors.html#brewer)
\*color-space\* \`x11' or \`svg'
\*label-color-dark\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*label-color-light\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*reachable-from\* Start node for calculating reachability
\*reachable-limit\* < 0 all reachable nodes, 0 start node only, 1 adjacent to start node, etc.
\*reachable-color\* Color name or number for reachable nodes
\*reachable-not-color\* Color name or number for unreachable nodes
\*origin-color\* Color name or number for the origin node in sequence diagram that maps chronology
\*adjacent-color\* Color name or number for nodes adjacent to the origin in a sequence diagram that maps chronology
\*url-include\* \`t' to include, \`nil' otherwise
\*url-default\* Default URL
\*graph-title\* Optional title for the graph
\*graph-labelloc\* \`t' for centering title, \`nil' otherwise
\*graph-style\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:style)
\*graph-size\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:size)
\*graph-ratio\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:ratio)
\*graph-page\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:page)
\*graph-dpi\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:dpi)
\*graph-margin\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:margin)
\*graph-font-name\* \`helvetica' or \`times'
\*graph-font-size\* Size in points
\*graph-font-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*graph-splines\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:splines)
\*graph-bg-color\* \`transparent', a color name, or an integer into a [Brewer color scheme](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/colors.html#brewer)
\*legend\* \`t' to include, \`nil' otherwise
\*legend-node-shape\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/shapes.html)
\*edge-style\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:style)
\*edge-with-arrow\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:arrowType)
\*edge-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*edge-font-name\* \`helvetica' or \`times'
\*edge-font-size\* Size in points
\*edge-font-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*node-style\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:style)
\*node-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*node-font-name\* \`helvetica' or \`times'
\*node-font-size\* Size in points
\*node-font-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*node-shape-interface\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/shapes.html)
\*node-shape-deposit\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/shapes.html)
\*node-fill\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*assume-correlations-true\* \`t' to merge contexts in the inferences table, \`nil' otherwise
\*chronology-graph-title\* Optional title for the chronology graph
\*chronology-graph-labelloc\* \`t' for centering title, \`nil' otherwise
\*chronology-graph-style\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:style)
\*chronology-graph-size\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:size)
\*chronology-graph-ratio\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:ratio)
\*chronology-graph-page\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:page)
\*chronology-graph-dpi\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:dpi)
\*chronology-graph-margin\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:margin)
\*chronology-graph-font-name\* \`helvetica' or \`times'
\*chronology-graph-font-size\* Size in points
\*chronology-graph-font-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*chronology-graph-splines\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#d:splines)
\*chronology-graph-bg-color\* \`transparent', a color name, or an integer into a [Brewer color scheme](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/colors.html#brewer)
\*chronology-edge-with-arrow\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:arrowType)
\*chronology-edge-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*chronology-edge-font-name\* \`helvetica' or \`times'
\*chronology-edge-font-size\* Size in points
\*chronology-edge-font-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*chronology-edge-date\* A style for an edge that connects to a date; [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:style)
\*chronology-edge-abutting\* A style for an edge that connects abutting phase boundaries; [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:style)
\*chronology-edge-separated\* A style for an edge that connects separated phase boundaries; [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:style)
\*chronology-node-style\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html#k:style)
\*chronology-node-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*chronology-node-font-name\* \`helvetica' or \`times'
\*chronology-node-font-size\* Size in points
\*chronology-node-font-color\* A color name from the indicated color-space
\*chronology-node-shape-interface\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/shapes.html)
\*chronology-node-shape-deposit\* [See \`dot' documentation](http://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/shapes.html)
\*chronology-node-fill\* A color name from the indicated color-space
# Plotting the Sequence Diagram I have two shell scripts to automate graph plotting on my Mac OS X system. They each take two arguments: * path to the `dot` file, without file extension * [output file type](http://www.graphviz.org/content/output-formats) This one simply plots and opens the graph. It will display all the arcs. `dot -T$2 $1.dot -o $1.$2` `open $1.$2` This one plots and opens the transitive reduction of the graph. Transitive reduction corresponds to Harris' Law of Stratigraphical Succession. `tred $1.dot > $1-tred.dot` `dot -T$2 $1-tred.dot -o $1-tred.$2` `open $1-tred.$2` # Workflow Legends are displayed as elements; no attempt at good layout is made. The `svg` output from `dot` can be edited with an application such as [Inkscape](http://www.inkscape.org/en/).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
